rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Uncertainty
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A state of incomplete knowledge that can result from a lack of information or from disagreement about what is known or even knowable. Uncertainty may come from many sources, from imprecision in the data to ambigously defined concepts or terminology, or uncertain projections of human bahavior. Uncertainty can be represented by quantitative measures (e.g., probability density function) or by qualitative statement (e.g., reflecting the judgement of a team of experts. Sensu IPCC AR5

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: detail
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the "of what" question for a Variable.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has DOI
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: As Digital Object Identifier for a given resource. For example: "oi:10.1191/095968301673881493"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: notes
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Notes regarding the cells in the DataTable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Climate interpretation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A suite of metadata that describe how a variable is interpreted to reflect past environmental variability

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Interpretation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A suite of metadata that describe how a variable is interpreted to reflect past variability, including environmental variability

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: calibration references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The publication that describes the calibration. The string should follow the model set in the publication class

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: chron modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: How was the chron data modeled?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Person
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A person that has participated directly or indirectly in the authoring or contribution of any resources in Linked Earth.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that serves as reference for a Dataset or its components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inorganic sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An inorganic sensor. Examples of inorganic sensors include: karst, snow, watershed, ice sheet, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Climate monitoring prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. This indirect assessment is made on proxies. According to Evans et al. (2013), a proxy system is comprised of three components: - A ProxySensor - A ProxyArchive - A ProxyObservation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measured variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A measured variable represents the values of a column in a data table. Measured variables are ssn:Observations. Measured variable observe Proxy Observation properties

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Model used to obtain the chronology

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of Variables organized in columns

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: paleo modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: How was the paleoData modeled?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: How was the process modeled?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy archive model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that links to the proxy archive model included in the proxy system model

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy system model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In the Evans et al. (2013) framework, this is the combination of sensor, archive and observation models . "A generalized proxy system model encapuslates a simplified representation of prior physical, chemical, biological, and/or geological understanding of the ways in which environmental variation ultimately results in the observations used to retrieve paleoclimatic information."

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has file name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the CSV file containing the data table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sensor genus
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Genus of the sensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has uncertainty
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What is the Uncertainty associated with the Observations, Model, and Calibration?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: contributor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Contributor of the resource (dataset, publication, etc.)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in summary table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates that the describer data or variable was found in a summary table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funded by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicated the funding which made the dataset possible

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: collected from
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Where was the data in the dataset collected from? Generally, this is the site where the archive was collected.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Book in which the publication was published

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicated the table where the described data can be found

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has resolution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What is the Resolution of the Archive?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes chron data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Pointer to the chron data included in the dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: relevant quote
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Relevant summary or preferably quotation from the referenced Publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: citation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sentence indicating how a paper should be published

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in measurement table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates that a variable was found in a measurement table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: title
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Title of a publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: published in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Where was the Dataset published? Property that relates a dataset to the publication where it was published.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Funding
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A source of funding for the creation of the Dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Any system that is at least partially isomorphic to some target system and used to derive information about the structure and/or dynamics of the target system.
The Linked Earth Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data
rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The Linked Earth Ontology
The Linked Earth Ontology
rdf:Description.dcterms:description: The Linked Earth Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpreted as
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: how is the variable interpreted?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy archive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Archive associated with the proxy system

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: model references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The publication that describes the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy sensor model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that links to the proxy sensor model included in the proxy system model

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Table containing relevant statistics from the ensemble table
Summary table
has column number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The table column number associated to a variable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Location
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The geographic data and metadata for the dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The sensor comprises physical, chemical, and/or biological components that react to environmental conditions. Sensors often respond to more than one environmental variable, and may have complex responses to the environment they sense, including thresholds (record only part of the range of environmental conditions), seasonal biases (record environmental conditions over a few months of the year), and/or nonlinear responses (Evans et al. (2013))

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funding country
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Country which awarded the funding for the dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy archive model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A simplified description of how the sensor either creates or emplaces the signal into the archive. sensu Evans et al. 2013.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Uncertainty model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formalization of the way the uncertainty is accounted for

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inferred variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Is the variable inferred from a measured variable?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Peer reviewed publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A publication that has undergone a formal peer-reviewed process.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The description of a resource. This property may be used to provide further details on instrument descriptions, uncertainty description,etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Proxy system associated to the measured variable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has ID
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: ID for a variable in a table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grant number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The grant number associated with the development of the Dataset?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy sensor model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A formalization of the behavior of the sensor in response to environmental forcing. Sensu Evans et al. 2013.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Isotope interpretation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A suite of metadata that describe how a MeasuredVariable with instance Isotope is interpreted to reflect past variability, including environmental variability

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has ISBN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Identifier used commonly to refer to publications.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PaleoData table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable containig PaleoData Variables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: seasonality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: fluctuating or restricted according to the season or time of year

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: publication year
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Year when the publication was published. The literal is a numeric value in the format yyyy

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has link
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A downloadable link of a resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Climate proxy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Climate observations prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. These observations are made on climate proxies in various geological (e.g. lake or marine sediments, living or fossil coral reefs, cave deposits), glaciological (ice cores or snow pits) or biological (trees) archives. Many types of measurements can be made on each archives, each sensing a different aspect of the environment (sometimes, several aspects at once). A paleoclimate dataset is a set of observations made on an archive.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in distribution table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates that a variable or data is found in a distribution table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ensemble table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Table containing possible series of age models or proxy variability

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is local
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Whether the influence on the MeasuredVariable (and therefore the Interpretation) is local or far-field. The literal is a string.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has rank
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes the importance of the ClimateInterpretation. For instance, d18Ocalcite is influenced by both temperature and d18Osw. If temperature is the dominant influence, then its rank is 1.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy observation model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The simplified representation of the way in which observations are made on the archive. sensu Evans et al. 2013.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: on proxy observation property
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Link to the proxy observation property observed in the current measured variable. For example, the observation "A" observed the proxy observation property "Mg/Ca"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Calibration model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Metadata about how the variable was calibrated to reflect an environmental variable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: calibrated with
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: How was the variable calibrated to represent climate or chronology?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has missing value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Indicates how the missing values are flagged in a dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Name of the described resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: volume
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The volume number in which the publication appeared.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An aggregation of DataTables and supporting information regarging the paleoenvironmental and/or chronological interpretation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: warnings
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Warnings of the variable or dataset being annotated

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: measured by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What Instrument was used to obtain the MeasuredVariables and Observations?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: method
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Method used to obtain the information from the resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Paleo model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Model describing how the measuredVariables are transformed into inferredVariables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has code
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What is the mathematical formulation that describes the Model?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: equation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The mathematical statement used to describe the model.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inferred from
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: From which measured variable is the current inferred variable obtained?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has execution environment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Execution environment of the code

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset version
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The version of the dataset. It should follow the x.y.z notation where x refers to changes in metadata and data following a publication (for instance, the creation of a new age model using a different code), y refers to changes to the data following a publication (for instance, adding data further back in time without changing the model underlying the interpretation), and z refers to changes not associated with a publication (for instance, typos).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Software code
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A script that describes the model, in any programming language (e.g., Excel, Matlab, Python, R)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pages
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The page range for the article.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset date
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Date when the dataset was published.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dataset
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A structured collection of related information, including - but not limited to - geographical, chronological, and measured or modeled paleoenvironmental data

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy observation model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that links to the proxy observation model included in the proxy system model

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Integration time
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The integration time of the Archive or the Sensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy observation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The type of measurements made on the archives, whether chemical (e.g., Mg/Ca, d18O, TEX86, Sr/Ca....), physical (e.g. density, layer thickness) or biological (e.g. species abundance).

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Distribution table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Table that contains the probability on the inferred variables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes paleo data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The paleo data included as part of a dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: email
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: email of an author or contributor

The class ssn:Observation provides the structure to represent a single observation. An observation is a situation that describes an observed feature, an observed property, a sensor and method of sensing used and a value observed for the property: that is, an observation describes a single value attributed to a single property by a particular sensor. Observations of multiple features or multiple properties of the one feature should be represented as either compound properties, features and values or as multiple observations, grouped in some appropriate structure.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: measured on
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: On what Archive were the Observations measured on?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What are the paleoenvironmental and chronological Data included in the Dataset?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sensor associated with the proxy system

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: issue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The issue number for the publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: orcid number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The ORCID number of the Person

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpretation references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes the basis by which the proxy variable is interpreted in terms of climate.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: principal investigator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Who is the PrincipalInvestigator of the Funding grant?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantities which can be measured or inferred independently in an experiment

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy archive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
The medium in which the response of a sensor to environmental forcing is recorded. Sensu Evans et al. (2013).
Examples of archives include: marine sediments, corals, wood, lake sediments, speleothems, glacier ice, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has units
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: units in which a resource is measured The resource can be a Variable, an Observation, a Resolution, or an Uncertainty

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: journal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicated the journal in which the publication has been published

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: author
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Author of the resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron data table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable containing the Chronology Variables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has execution command
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The execution command needed to run the script or software

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Non peer reviewed publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A publication that has not undergone a formal review process; for instance, a Dataset attached to a dissertation.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurement table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Table that contains the measuredVariables made on the Archive

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sensor species
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The species of the sensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Paleo data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Data pertaining to past environmental variability

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpretation direction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Describes whether the interpreted environmental variable increases (positive) or decreases (negative) as the paleoDataVariableValue increases. The literal is a string , either "positive" or "negative"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in ensemble table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates that the data or variable described was found in an ensemble table

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: standard
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The standard against which the observations are reported (for instance, VSMOW or VPDB)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Resolution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Refers to the distance (physical or temporal) between each point on the archive. May or May not be related to sampling. Value with units

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Instrument
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A tool or implement used to produce MeasuredVariables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron proxy
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The data and metadata associated with how the chronology information was obtained.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A column of values for the variable. The literal can be in the form of a vector of values (for instance d18O PaleoObservations), a vector of strings (for instance different paleoArchiveNames), a matrix or both

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy observation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Type of proxy observation associtated with the proxy system (e.g, Mg/Ca)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Crhon data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Data pertaining to chronological information

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sensing with
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that links the proxy archive to the target proxy sensor. This property determines how the archive senses the environment

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: taken at depth
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Depth result at which the observation is taken

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Organic sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An organic sensor. Examples of organic sensors include: foraminifera, trees, mollusks, polyps, etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: What are the Variables included in the DataTable?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: calibrated from
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Property that indicates how the measured variable was calibrated

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: uncertainty level
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantile or number of standard deviations along a probability distribution of a Variable.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funding agency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The agency that funded the development of the Dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has ISSN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: 8-digit code used to udentify publications
